Submodules¶

advantage.charger module¶

class advantage.charger.Charger(name: str, charging_points: List[ChargingPoint])[source]¶

Bases: object

Dataclass that implements charger which can interact with ChargingPoints and their plugs.

Depicts a charging station with possibly multiple charging points.

Parameters

  • name (str) – Name/ID of the station.

  • charging_points (list["ChargingPoint"]) – List of ChargingPoint objects.

classmethod from_json(name, number_charging_points: int, plug_types: List[PlugType])[source]¶

This classmethod returns an instance of Charger with an initialized charging_points attribute.

Parameters

  • name (str) – Name/ID of the station.

  • number_charging_points (int) – Number of charging stations.

  • plug_types (list["PlugType"]) – List of plugs that the newly created charger will support.

Returns

Charger instance that is created from the parameters.

Return type

Charger

get_scenario_info(point_id: str, plug_types: List[str]) → Dict[str, Dict[str, Dict[str, Dict[str, object]]]][source]¶

Create the spiceev scenario dict for the charger.

Parameters

  • point_id (str) – Chosen charging point

  • plug_types (list[str]) – Plug types of the connected vehicle

Returns

Nested dictionary with all available charging points.

Return type

dict

Raises

  • ValueError – If point_id doesn’t match any possible ChargingPoints in the Charger instance.

  • ValueError – If Charger doesn’t have any charging points.

property num_points: int¶

This get method returns the number of charging points at this Charger object.

Returns

Number of charging points.

Return type

int

class advantage.charger.PlugType(name: str, capacity: float, plug: Optional[str] = None)[source]¶

Bases: object

Class implements any type of plug given the parameters.

Parameters

  • name (str) – Identifier of this plug type.

  • capacity (float) – Capacity is specified in kW (kilowatt).

  • plug (str, optional) – Type of plug. Example: “CCS”, “inductive”, “Schucko”

advantage.location module¶

class advantage.location.Location(name: str = '', location_type: str = '', chargers: Optional[List[Charger]] = None, grid_info: Optional[dict] = None, event_csv: Optional[bool] = True)[source]¶

Bases: object

This class implements a location.

This class allows type checking.

name¶

Name/ID of the location.

Type

str

location_type¶

Location type can be “depot”, “station”, etc.

Type

str

chargers¶

List of chargers at the given location.

Type

list, optional

grid_info¶

Dictionary with grid connection in kW, load and generator time series. Example: {“power”: 50, “load”: load_df, “generator”: gen_df}

Type

dict, optional

output¶

Comprises information on grid power and connected vehicles in total and for every charging point.

Type

dict

property available¶

This methods checks availability.

Create SpiceEV scenario dict for this Location.

Parameters

  • point_id (str, optional) – ID of a specific charging point

Returns

dict

This method checks if the grid power is above zero.

update_output(start_time, end_time, step_size, time_steps, charging_power_list)[source]¶

Records newest output when it is called during the vehicle method charge().

Parameters

  • start_time (int) – Starting step of charging

  • end_time (int) – Excluded end step of charging

  • step_size (int) – Charging time in steps

  • time_steps (int) – Number of steps in the scenario

  • charging_power_list (list) – Charging power for each step during the charging event

advantage.simulation module¶

This script includes the Simulation class.

Classes¶

Simulation

class advantage.simulation.Simulation(vehicle_types, charging_points, cfg_dict, data_dict)[source]¶

Bases: object

This class can import a specified config directory and build a Simulation out of the given scenario.

It also contains the run function, which starts the simulation.

soc_min¶

Lower limit of the battery’s charging power (soc - state of charge).

Type

float

rng_seed¶

Seed for generating numbers pseudo-randomly.

Type

int

min_charging_power¶

Minimum charging power of the vehicles.

Type

float

start_date¶

Start date of the simulation.

Type

datetime.date

end_date¶

End date of the simulation.

Type

datetime.date

num_threads¶

Number of threads to determine the concurrency of the simulation.

Type

int

schedule¶

Pandas Dataframe with information about the specific route of the given vehicle fleet.

Type

pandas.core.frame.DataFrame

vehicle_types¶

Dictionary with strings of types of vehicles as keys and instances of the class VehicleType as values.

Type

dict

locations¶

Dictionary with strings of locations as keys and instances of the class Location as the values.

Type

dict

plug_types¶

Dictionary with strings of the plug-type and dictionaries comprised of the name, capacity and charging_type as values.

Type

dict

weights¶

Dictionary with weight factors for all criteria of the charging point evaluation function.

Type

dict

evaluate_charging_location(**kwargs)¶
classmethod from_config(config_path, no_outputs_mode=False)[source]¶

Creates a Simulation object from the specified scenario.

The scenario needs to be located in the directory /scenarios. A scenario consists of different inputs like charging_points, schedule, vehicle_types and a config file called scenario which are read and processed in order to create a Simulation object.

Parameters

  • config_path (str) – Path to the scenario config.

  • no_outputs_mode (bool) – Flag that indicates if output is needed.

Returns

Simulation object

Return type

Simulation

Raises

FileNotFoundError – If the scenario is not found in the ./scenarios directory. If the config file scenario.cfg is not found or can’t be read..

get_end_of_day_timestep(step)[source]¶

Returns the last time step of the day of the given step.

Parameters

step (int) – Reference time step.

Returns

End of day time step

Return type

int

Creates SimulationType object depending on self.simulation_type and runs it.

advantage.spiceev_interface module¶

advantage.spiceev_interface.get_charging_characteristic(scenario, feed_in_cost, emission_df=None, emission_options=None)[source]¶

Calculate average cost and part of charging from feed-in in a spice_ev scenario.

Parameters

  • scenario (Scenario) – SpiceEV Scenario object.

  • feed_in_cost (float) – Cost of feed in energy in €/kWh

  • emission_df (pandas.DataFrame) – Time series of emission values in g/kWh

  • emission_options (dict) – “column”: Column name of emission values in emission_df “start_time”: Iso string of first entry in time series “step_duration”: Duration covered by one time step in seconds

Returns

Keys: “cost” contains total cost in €, “feed_in”: renewable part of charging energy [0-1], “emission”: total CO2-emission in g, “grid_energy”: total charge in kWh

Return type

dict[string, float]

advantage.spiceev_interface.get_current_time_series_value(timestamp: datetime, dataframe, dataframe_options: dict)[source]¶

Gets the current emission value for a given timestamp and set of emission options.

Parameters

  • timestamp (datetime.datetime) – The timestamp to get the value for.

  • dataframe (pandas.DataFrame) – A DataFrame containing the time series data.

  • dataframe_options (dict) –

    A dictionary containing the dataframe options. Required keys: - “start_time” : datetime.datetime

    The start time of the time series.

    • ”step_duration”int

      The duration of each time step in seconds.

    • ”column”str

      The name of the column containing the data in dataframe.

Returns

The current emission value at the given timestamp.

Return type

np.float64

Raises

  • KeyError – If any of the required keys are missing from emission_options.

  • IndexError – If the timestep calculated based on the given timestamp is outside the range of emission_df.

advantage.spiceev_interface.get_spice_ev_scenario_dict(vehicle, location, point_id, timestamp: datetime, time, cost_options, step_size=1)[source]¶

This function creates a dictionary for SpiceEV.

Parameters

  • vehicle (Vehicle) – Given Vehicle object for this SpiceEV scenario.

  • location (Location) – Used location.

  • point_id (int) – ID of the ChargingPoint.

  • timestamp (str) – Timestamp that marks the starting time.

  • time (int) – Number of time intervals.

Returns

Nested SpiceEV dictionary.

Return type

dict

advantage.spiceev_interface.run_spice_ev(spice_ev_dict, strategy, ignore_warnings=True) → Scenario[source]¶

This function runs the scenario and returns it.

Parameters

advantage.vehicle module¶

class advantage.vehicle.Vehicle(vehicle_id: str, vehicle_type: VehicleType = VehicleType(name='vehicle_name', battery_capacity=50.0, soc_min=0.2, base_consumption=0.0, charging_capacity={}, charging_curve=[], min_charging_power=0.0, event_csv=True, label=None), status: Status = Status.PARKING, soc: float = 1.0, availability: bool = True, rotation: Optional[str] = None, current_location: Optional[Location] = None)[source]¶

Bases: object

The vehicle contains tech parameters as well as tasks.

Parameters

  • id (str) – ID of the vehicle.

  • vehicle_type (VehicleType) – VehicleType of the Vehicle instance.

  • status (Status) – Describes current state of the Vehicle object wrapped in an Enum. Status: DRIVING, PARKING, CHARGING

  • soc (float) – State of charge: Current charge of the battery. Shown in percentage.

  • availability (bool) – Boolean that states if Vehicle is available. Default on True.

  • rotation (str, optional) –

  • current_location (Location, optional) – Has current location if Vehicle was already to one assigned.

  • task (None) –

  • output (dict) – Comprises all relevant information of the Vehicle object like locations, statuses, etc. It gets updated by the private method _update_activity.

add_task(task: Task)[source]¶

Add a task to the self.tasks using the start_time as key.

class advantage.vehicle.VehicleType(name: str = 'vehicle_name', battery_capacity: float = 50.0, soc_min: float = 0.2, base_consumption: float = 0.0, charging_capacity: dict = <factory>, charging_curve: list = <factory>, min_charging_power: float = 0.0, event_csv: bool = True, label: ~typing.Optional[str] = None)[source]¶

Bases: object

The VehicleType contains static vehicle data.

Parameters

  • name (str) – Name/ID for the vehicle type.

  • battery_capacity (float) – Battery capacity in kWh.

  • soc_min (float) – Minimum state of charge that should remain in battery after a drive. Shown in percentage.

  • base_consumption (float) – Base/average consumption of the vehicle type in kWh/km.

  • charging_capacity (dict) – Dictionary containing values for each viable plug and their respective capacity. Example: {“plug_0”: 50, “plug_1”: 150}

  • charging_curve (list) – List of list with two numbers. First number is SoC (state of charge) and second the possible maximum power in kW. Example: [[0, 50], [0.8, 50], [1, 20]]

  • min_charging_power (float) – Least amount of charging power possible, as a share of max power. Shown in percentage.

  • label (str, optional) –

base_consumption: float = 0.0¶
battery_capacity: float = 50.0¶
charging_capacity: dict¶
charging_curve: list¶
event_csv: bool = True¶
label: Optional[str] = None¶
min_charging_power: float = 0.0¶
name: str = 'vehicle_name'¶
property plugs¶
soc_min: float = 0.2¶
